channel.title: Can i change my username?
channel.description:
Hello moparians,
Last time....i was thinking , why can't i change my username? Thats a stupid question , cause people got already that username.
But i wanted the username 'Rocky' , the username Rocky was last active 18 September 2007 , thats like 5 years ago.(Profile http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=179404 ) I wanted that username , but the one who had that username ... didnt use that username , so the username 'Rocky' can't be used.
Why don't we add a system for people who doesnt use their profile for 1.5year , delete their profile.(this suggestion comes in Suggest section)
Regards , Ircdscape (sorry for my bad english)

item.title: Can i change my username?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:18, topic:447669”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=550561.msg4036354#msg4036354 date=1341248669]

no

Pretty much what I was thinking. Members come back all the time, so this is one thing I’ll always be against. Also, we don’t approve suggestion topics unless they’re popular among staff members.

But why is it that the staff are the only ones opinion that essentially matter when picking things for the community? With everything it seems the community comes last, in most situations usually the customers (just saying customers but you know what I mean as essentionally we are your customers, without us their would be no Moparscape, likewise to staff however the site cannot run on staff alone) that you try to please. Yes, you want the staff to be pleased too but it shouldn’t be like what it is right now but I blame that on MITB himself. The way he is reflects in some of the staff members but then again ofc you want your staff to do what you’d do…
[/quote]
We basically filter out the suggestions that are either impossible or extremely hard to add to the forum, or are just unnecessary etc.
It’s not that we are trying to ‘please’ ourselves at all, you’re taking it from completely the wrong direction.[/quote]
Well staff say a lot of the time its unnesasry, this sites unnessasary but we still have it. If it pleases the community its not unnecessary o.o?

Read full topic

item.title: Can i change my username?
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Perhaps we could have a checklist of requirements to request a name change to one that has already been taken, for instance:

  • The owner of the username you want must have had < 50 posts.
  • Must have been inactive for at least 2 years.
  • Must have < 1 Day logged on time.

Of course this list could have flaws, but it’s just something I came up with real fast. Obviously it would need to be revised and modified. Perhaps this could be added as well, if it meets those requirements, an email would be sent to the email registered to the username, and if they didn’t respond in x amount of days or click a link that says they wish to keep the username, then the requesting user could obtain that username. My apologies if my explanation seems a bit confusing, 2:30 in the morning right now and just wanted to voice a suggestion.

Read full topic

With everything it seems the community comes last, in most situations usually the customers (just saying customers but you know what I mean as essentionally we are your customers, without us their would be no Moparscape, likewise to staff however the site cannot run on staff alone) that you try to please. Yes, you want the staff to be pleased too but it shouldn’t be like what it is right now but I blame that on MITB himself. The way he is reflects in some of the staff members but then again ofc you want your staff to do what you’d do…[/quote]
We basically filter out the suggestions that are either impossible or extremely hard to add to the forum, or are just unnecessary etc.
It’s not that we are trying to ‘please’ ourselves at all, you’re taking it from completely the wrong direction.

Read full topic

item.title: Can i change my username?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

It wont happen, only well respected+popular people can name changes that are more than a punctuation change. I can see why they disallow it though, it can get confusing.
I asked for one and I got ignored, twice(in total) by two different people lul.

Read full topic

item.title: Can i change my username?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

ytuio9`:

Highly doubt this will pass through, and other thing is the policy on name changes is a bit weird, you most likely won’t get a huge name change (maybe fixing an underscore or something)

This. I went from Scape-JAVA to SJ_ back to Scape-JAVA. But that’s only because people knew me under both alias’s.

And OP, for your question. Because people sometimes go inactive for a year or so, then come back. That’s why profiles aren’t automatically deleted after a certain period of inactivity.

Read full topic
